summary: SummaryHighlightsClean IngredientsHSA/FSA eligibleCeraVe Acne Foaming Cream Cleanser with 4% BPO for Acne Prone Skin with ceramides and benzoyl peroxide cleanses and helps clear acne while leaving skin feeling soft and comfortable.
details: DetailsBenefitsUnique foaming cream face wash formula with benzoyl peroxide, hyaluronic acid and niacinamide works to gently remove dirt and excess oil without leaving skin feeling stripped of moistureHelps clear pimples, whiteheads and blackheads without dryness or flakingHelps prevent new acne from formingAllows blemishes to healHelps maintain the skin barrier with three essential ceramidesFeatures soothing ingredients to help calm the skinIdeal for acne-prone and oily skinNon-comedogenicFragrance FreeParaben FreeDeveloped with dermatologistsCeraVe is the No. 1 dermatologist-recommended moisturizer brand for acne**No. 1 recommended non-OTC moisturizer brand for acne-prone skin. Source: IQVIA, ProSource Survey, 11/1/2019-10/31/2020.Key Ingredients4% Benzoyl peroxide helps clear acne and blackheads, minimize excess oil and prevent future breakoutsCeramides help restore and maintain the natural skin barrierHyaluronic acid attracts hydration to the skin's surface and helps the skin retain moistureNiacinamide helps calm the skinFormulated WithoutFragranceParabensItem 2556948How To UseUse every morning and evening. Apply a dime-size amount to damp skin and gently massage, avoiding the eye area. Rinse well. Use wash on entire affected area one to two times daily. Because excess drying of the skin may occur, start with one application daily, then gradually increase two times daily if needed or as directed by a doctor. If bothersome dryness or peeling occurs, reduce application to once a day or every other day. If going outside, apply sunscreen after using this product. If irritation or sensitivity develops. stop use of both products and ask a doctor.Build your Everyday Routine with CeraVe:Step 1: Cleanse with CeraVe Acne Foaming Cream CleanserStep 2: Treat with CeraVe Resurfacing Retinol SerumMorning Step 3: Moisturize & Protect with CeraVe AM Facial Moisturizing Lotion with Broad Spectrum SPF 30Night Step 3: Moisturize with CeraVe PM Facial Moisturizing LotionPrecautions: For external use only.IngredientsActive: Benzoyl Peroxide 4%. Inactive: Water, Glycerin, Propylene Glycol, Cocamidopropyl Hydroxysultaine, Sodium C14-16 Olefin Sulfonate, Xanthan Gum, Potassium Hydroxide, Ceramide Np, Ceramide Ap, Ceramide Eop, Carbomer, Niacinamide, Glycolic Acid, Sodium Chloride, Sodium Citrate, Sodium Hyaluronate, Sodium Lauroyl Lactylate, Sodium Hydroxide, Cholesterol, Phenoxyethanol, Propanediol, Citric Acid, Tetrasodium Edta, Diethylhexyl Sodium Sulfosuccinate, Phytosphingosine, Ethylhexylglycerin, Benzoic Acid.
how_to_use: Use every morning and evening. Apply a dime-size amount to damp skin and gently massage, avoiding the eye area. Rinse well. Use wash on entire affected area one to two times daily. Because excess drying of the skin may occur, start with one application daily, then gradually increase two times daily if needed or as directed by a doctor. If bothersome dryness or peeling occurs, reduce application to once a day or every other day. If going outside, apply sunscreen after using this product. If irritation or sensitivity develops. stop use of both products and ask a doctor.Build your Everyday Routine with CeraVe:Step 1: Cleanse with CeraVe Acne Foaming Cream CleanserStep 2: Treat with CeraVe Resurfacing Retinol SerumMorning Step 3: Moisturize & Protect with CeraVe AM Facial Moisturizing Lotion with Broad Spectrum SPF 30Night Step 3: Moisturize with CeraVe PM Facial Moisturizing LotionPrecautions: For external use only.

reviews.headline: Great for Sensitive Skin and Beginners
reviews.comments: This is my first time using retinol and I've been using it for about 2 months now. For context, I have combination to dry, sensitive skin and I'm in my early 20s. Aging isn't my main concern yet, but I want to start introducing products like this into my routine for the future. I do have some fine lines (from school and working in customer service) and occasional breakouts, but my main concerns are sun damage and hyperpigmentation. I'm very pale and burn easily, and because I didn't use sunscreen consistently as a teen, some sun damage is already visible. I was hesitant to start retinol because I worried about purging and peeling, and I did experience a slight increase in breakouts, but nothing extreme. I began using it twice a week at night with the "retinol sandwich" method, applying a lightweight moisturizer or hydrating toner first to prevent dryness, then a pea-sized amount of retinol, followed by another layer of moisturizer. It takes a little practice to spread such a small amount evenly across the face, but I've managed to make it work (Please stick to the recommended amount. Using more is the fastest way to damage your skin barrier). After about two weeks, I tried applying it on bare skin, which my skin tolerated, and then I resumed the sandwich method while increasing use to three times a week, hoping to eventually build up to daily use. I also tried it a few times on my neck following the same method, and it seems to tolerate it well. The serum has a slightly yellowish color, absorbs quickly, and feels weightless on my skin, making it easy to layer with other products. So far, I've noticed slight improvements in the appearance of my pores and uneven skin tone. I'm curious to see if I can get more benefits from it since the concentration is pretty low, or if I'll need to move to a stronger retinol once my skin fully adjusts. Overall, it's been a gentle and effective introduction to retinol for my sensitive skin.

reviews.headline: This cleared my skin within a week
reviews.comments: I broke out reallyyyyy bad which i never do and my doctor gave me this product and my skin never looked betterü•πü•π

reviews.headline: Healed my cystic acne!!!
reviews.comments: For over a year I have suffered from terrible cystic acne. After using this product for a month I have virtually no more break outs. I am so happy that I found this product

reviews.headline: Effective spot treatment
reviews.comments: I didn't really use this product as a cleanser more so a spot treatment for body acne and I would say it did help dry up acne faster than just letting it go away on its own. I left on for about 15 minutes and my new acne would completely dry up in about 3 days. it can be drying in my opinion so that's why I wouldn't personally use it as a cleanser.

reviews.headline: Love it!
reviews.comments: [I received this product in exchange for my honest review] Great product! It does everything it needs to do plus more. It is so gentle on the skin and helps with all my acne problems. If you have sensitive skin please be careful!

reviews.headline: Amazing Product
reviews.comments: I have textured, sensitive skin with acne scars, and this product has helped me so much. This one of the only retinol's that did not make me peel off. Friends and family have asked me what I've been using because my skin looks amazing.

reviews.headline: Acne cleanser
reviews.comments: [I received this product in exchange for my honest review] acne clay to foam cleanser !! this product is great for getting rid of acne with salicylic acid and also cleanses ur face. it also soothes our skin with glycerin so i think this is a perfect cleanser!!

reviews.headline: Changed my skin for the better!
reviews.comments: I have oily skin and even as a 40yo I would get breakouts. I had a lot of blackheads but this product slowly but surely cleans them out. I can watch as a pimple tries to form and after washing with this cleanser at night, I wake up and the blemish is gone. My skin is glowing now and I hardly ever wear a foundation or concealer to even put my tone because it already looks good and natural! A little goes a really long way so it's a great value as well.

reviews.headline: For the Pits!
reviews.comments: I no longer use Benzyl Peroxide on my face but the keep it as a shower staple. Works great for body acne and is awesome for washing the armpits! The BPO kills the bacteria that causes "funky" smell.

reviews.headline: The Best!
reviews.comments: I started to get a lot of whitheads after getting off birth control and got worse once I got pregnant. I added this to my routine morning and night and my acne cleared up. I have combo skin.

reviews.headline: Best retinol for young adults
reviews.comments: Long time user (been using this retinol  since I was in my late teens). Not only is it way more affordable compared to other retinoids but it is extremely effective. Its moisturizing by itself, many times I apply it at PM without adding moisturizer on top. Its great for clearing/reducing acne as well. Overall I would recommend this retional for anyone with teenage hormonal acne/young adults.

reviews.headline: Best Acne Wash
reviews.comments: I have severe acne and hyperpigmentation and it has cleared my skin ive been using it for a week and would buy more of it

reviews.headline: Miracle product
reviews.comments: My dermatologist recommended this to me for my hormonal acne. She gave me a few trial sizes to test for myself before I committed to buying the full size. I'm glad she did because this has been working wonders for my face. I'm in my mid 30s and hormonal acne has been a struggle for years now. I have seen a major improvement as well as smoothness of my face. Got rid of my acne and doesn't dry my face out. I have paired it with the acne serum from the same line and I promise people, this will help you feel more confident.

reviews.headline: Great for my body acne
reviews.comments: I recently started hormone therapy and had really bad breakouts on my shoulders and decided to try using this to see if it would help, and it has completely eliminated my acne. Wish this came in a larger size cause I go through it fast.

reviews.headline: Effective & Affordable
reviews.comments: 46F This retinol cream works for me! Brightens, evens, fights breakouts and blackheads, is gentle, and affordable.  Note: I don't really have wrinkles yet and am hopeful that this will keep them away.

reviews.headline: Love this product
reviews.comments: I have oily, aging skin with some bump...it has worked really well to smooth my skin.

reviews.headline: This works so well with my oily skin
reviews.comments: Part of my night time routine.  I use this with the CeraVe  skin renewing night cream.  What a difference in the texture and smoothness of my skin.  I have received several compliments on my skin.

reviews.headline: Been using for 5 years!!
reviews.comments: Back in 2020 when Skincare by Hyram started blowing up and influencing everyone stuck at home during the pandemic, i discovered cerave. I had started using the teal and white bottle of facewash with the pump but i just wasn't a fan of the weird smell. I then discovered this face wash. This facewash has tremendously helped me heal my acne. It helped get rid of closed commedones on my forehead, although now i have some on my chin / cheek area (which is due to using too many acid products, im currently giving my skin a break‚Ä¶) but i genuinly could not choose a better wash and won't ever change it up! They have the 4% which is what i use and then a 10% Benzoyl Peroxide version, i tried it once when it came out which was okay for me but keep in mind it feels more like a lotion than a wash‚Ä¶ i just saved myself the extra dollar or so and stuck with the 4%. Anyways, what you can take from this is that this face wash has NEVER let me down üôè

reviews.headline: Love it
reviews.comments: It's the only thing that has been able to keep my acne away

reviews.headline: Cleanser
reviews.comments: Cleared most of my skin and is refreshing, can be drying make sure to moisturize after using

faceoff_positive.comments: i've been looking on the market for an acne scar treatment that isn't totally overpriced and there i am in the store and i find this. i didn't get my hope too high because this is the first acne scar treatment i have used. i have struggled with my acne since puberty until now (17), it wasn't just a pimple here and there my skin was struggling, i would cover it up with pounds of makeup, pick, get super dry etc. recently by the miracle of god i started to clear up which was very exciting for me but the reality of being left with minor texture problems and very prominent acne scars trickled around my cheeks and forehead set in :( anyways, i started using this product after a gentle wash, witch hazel toner, this serum, and then a gentle moisturizer and even freebies the first night i noticed a difference!!!!! i've been using it ever since and my skin looks incredible :))) this product is proof you don't need to spend half of your paycheck to get a quality product.
faceoff_positive.headline: miracle serum!

faceoff_negative.comments: I am greatly disappointed with this product. I love Cera Ve products but this product has made my skin irritated and has severely stained my cloths and my towel. I normally did not have this problem with the 4% version of this product. I am disappointed that I wasted money and now I have to waste more money when this situation could of been avoided.
faceoff_negative.headline: Not Satisfied
